title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 15
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey 

The General Classification saw one major move, the inverse of yesterday's shift as Guillaume Martin lost his swiftly gained second place and fell down to 9th overall, after failing to keep pace with the leading group.

Martin's breakaway companion yesterday, Matteo Cattaneo, also fell out of the top ten as Peio Bilboa moved up into 10th. Beyond that slight reordering, the GC has remained more or less unchanged, with Pogačar's overall lead increasing.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Rigoberto Urán +5:18
3. Jonas Vingegaard +5:32
4. Richard Carapaz +5:33
5. Ben O'Connor +5:58
6. Wilco Kelderman +6:16
7. Alexey Lutsenko +7:01
9. Enric Mas +7:11
9. Guillaume Martin +7:58
10. Peio Bilbao +10:59

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

Though closest rival Matthews gained 20 points today, Mark Cavendish has an emphatic lead in this competition for Deceuninck Quick-Step and comfortably made the time cut.

1. Mark Cavendish - 279 points
2. Michael Matthews - 207 points
3. Jasper Philipsen - 174 points
4. Sonny Colbrelli - 159 points
5. Julian Alaphilippe - 131 points

The Tour de France jerseys – the race so far

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

After a strong ride to take third place on the stage, Wout Poels has shifted Michael Woods off the top spot, though it's all to play for with small gaps and big Pyrenean days still to come.

1. Wout Poels - 74 points
2. Michael Woods - 66 points
3. Nairo Quintana - 64 points
4. Wout van Aert - 64 points
5. Bauke Mollema - 41 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

David Gaudu and Aurélien Paret-Peintre gained time in the Young Rider's Classification after today's successful top 10 finishes in the second group on the road, but remain some way off Pogacar and Vingegaard.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:32
3. Aurélien Paret-Peintre +21:15
4. David Gaudu +27:15
5. Sergio Higuita +57:26

Team Classification

1. Bahrain Victorious
2. EF Education-Nippo +11:37
3. AG2R Citroen +26:21
4. Jumbo-Visma +32:02
5. Ineos Grenadiers +33:24

Cover image: A.S.O./Pauline Ballet
author: Peter Stuart
